MAINTENANCE MECHANIC

SUMMARY

I am a graduate with an Associate of Applied Science in Power-plant & Airframe Technology and with an FAA A&P license with experience in troubleshooting, repairing and maintaining aircraft engines and systems as well as repairing and rebuilding aircraft structures and functional components. I'm currently working as a maintenance mechanic with Fairmount Santrol, with experience in splicing belts, rebuilding pumps, changing motors, bearing and gearboxes.
Detail-oriented and very efficient, I am seeking a position with a company that fully utilizes my experience and abilities.

Maintenance Inspections Repairs Troubleshooting

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr Procurement Buyer

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

About Honeywell

Honeywell International Inc. (Nasdaq: HON) invents and commercializes technologies that address some of the world’s most critical challenges around energy, safety, security, air travel, productivity, and global urbanization. We are a leading software-industrial company committed to introducing state of the art technology solutions to improve efficiency, productivity, sustainability, and safety in high growth businesses in broad-based, attractive industrial end markets. Our products and solutions enable a safer, more comfortable, and more productive world, enhancing the quality of life of people around the globe.

THE BUSINESS UNIT

Honeywell Connected Aerospace (HCA) has subscription-based offerings serving the aviation industry. As part of HCE, the organization is expanding the offerings to serve not only the ramp to flight but also from the ramp into the hangar and beyond. HCA serves the airlines, business, and general aviation (BGA), and defense verticals. The aircraft is just one piece of the aerospace ecosystem. From worker optimization to asset management, today's airlines, MROs, and OEMs need digitalization, sustainability, and OT cybersecurity solutions that span the entire operation. Honeywell Forge is an enterprise performance management (EPM) solution for aerospace operations built to manage enterprise data, reduce fuel consumption, meet sustainability goals, digitalize critical assets, and provide cybersecurity for operational technology.

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

As a Sr. Procurement Buyer here at Honeywell, you will play a crucial role in managing the procurement and fulfilment process for aerospace products. You will be responsible for sourcing and purchasing materials, negotiating with suppliers, and ensuring timely delivery of products to meet customer demands. Your expertise in procurement and supply chain management will contribute to the success of our aerospace operations and help us maintain a competitive edge in the market.

You will report directly to our Procurement Manager and you'll work out of our Deer Valley AZ location on a hybrid work schedule.

In this role, you will impact the efficiency and effectiveness of our supply chain by ensuring timely procurement and delivery of materials. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop sourcing strategies, evaluate supplier performance, and drive continuous improvement in the procurement process.

Key Responsibilities

Source and purchase materials to meet production and customer demandsNegotiate pricing and terms with suppliers to ensure cost-effective procurementCollaborate with cross-functional teams to develop sourcing strategiesEvaluate supplier performance and drive continuous improvementEnsure timely delivery of materials to meet production schedulesMonitor inventory levels and optimize inventory management processesMaintain strong relationships with suppliers and manage supplier performance.Conduct regular order book reviews with assigned suppliers to manage purchase order date fidelity and support the acknowledgement/commit validation process.Utilize the tiered escalation process to engage support for issues as they arise and could impact the performance of the site(s) being supported.

Benefits Of Working For Honeywell

 Benefits – Medical, Vision, Dental, Mental Health Paid Vacation 401k Plan/Retirement Benefits (as per regional policy) Career Growth Professional Development

YOU MUST HAVE

Minimum of 5 years of experience in procurement or supply chain management1+ years SAP experience

WE VALUE

Government contracting procurement experience (FAR12, FAR15)Strong knowledge of procurement processes and best practicesExcellent negotiation and communication skills Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business, or a related fieldComfortable interacting directly with SuppliersExperience in the aerospace industryStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to work well in a fast-paced and dynamic environmentContinuous learning and adaptabilitySelf-motivated and excellent organizational skillsProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD228910Category: ProcurementLocation: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United StatesExemptDue to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status.

Business Services

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
